TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {41637=I did feel sorry for the folks in San Diego and seeing how their July 4 fireworks popped at one time., 29559=The theme for 2013 will be announced and light refreshments will be provided.  , 35751=The Friends of Andrew Jackson State Park held a grand film review July 12 to introduce the four mini-documentaries on the young Jackson and the Revolutionary War history of the Waxhaws area., 26947=There will be a second deadline of Feb. 15., 29357=The rally will feature speakers from the community who have benefitted from the funds raised at Relay for Life, will honor cancer survivors and celebrate the 2012 fundraising teams., 51952=Copyright © 2015, 22955=Three trustees have been re-elected to the J. Starks were re-elected to their third three-year terms and will begin their service on Oct. 1., 23813=The Christian Services food pantry is open from 1:30 to 4 p.m. Monday through Friday., 34291=Frank Hartley and his wife Betty may be best known locally for running Hartley’s Appliance on South Main Street in Lancaster for 30 years. Some residents and newcomers may not know, however, that Frank Hartley has been playing country and bluegrass music for more than 50 years; a talent that landed him on stage at Carnegie Hall in 1984., 28194=Held annually since 2006 on the last Tuesday of September, the Look Who’s Cooking benefit unites the community to fund more research for a disorder that affects one in every 88 children., 21858=Laura Caskey lcaskey@thelancasternews.com For the months of October and November, The Lancaster Garden Club is asking members of the Lancaster community to plant or display mums of all varieties and colors through their project “Mum’s the Word.” Each household or business is encouraged to display mums so Lancaster visitors will see an ocean of fall colors in the town. Chrysanthemums, often called “mums,” come in a variety of natural shades, including fall colors like red, yellow, orange and white., 41416=The grilled steaks and sweet iced tea were good, but the July 3 death of Andy Griffith sorta dampened my enthusiasm. I opted to watch the fireworks going off over the Mall in Washington, D.C., via TV., 26665=The U. S. Department of Agriculture’s Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) State Conservationist for S.C., Ann English, announced the first sign up deadline for priority assistance through the Environmental Quality Incentives Program (EQIP) is Oct. 19., 32595=The awards were distributed at the 30th Annual PALMY Awards and Advertising Summit on June 7 in Columbia.}
